name: Rattlesnake Plantain
description: Goodyera schlechtendaliana var. nishikiran is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly Japan, China, and Taiwan. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (10-20 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive intricate vein patterns that resemble precious metalwork. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Prized more for their beautiful leaves than flowers, unlike most orchids. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of temperate to subtropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant is perfect for small spaces and terrariums. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive veined foliage.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
